steps.title: Pick out a pair of pants with a slim fit.
steps.content: Pick out a pair of pants with a slim fit. This pants style helps balance out the bulkiness of your Timberlands. [1] X Research source For a winter ensemble, pull a pair of socks into the bottoms of your pants. Then, tuck both your socks and pants into your Timbs.

steps.title: Roll up your pants so they stop just above the tongue of your boot.
steps.content: Roll up your pants so they stop just above the tongue of your boot. Make the cuff around 2 inches (5.1 cm) wide and roll it 3 times to get a hem that falls just above the boot. This basic cuff works best with a slim-cut pair of pants.

steps.title: Timbs and comfy bottoms are great for lounging around.
steps.content: Timbs and comfy bottoms are great for lounging around. Top the outfit off with a flannel to complete this cozy look. [2] X Research source Elevate the look with an interesting sweater or bag to keep it more fashion-forward. Keep your look casual with a hoodie.

steps.title: Leave the laces out of the top 2 eyelets.
steps.content: Leave the laces out of the top 2 eyelets. Then, loosen up the laces and either leave them untied or tie them loosely. [3] X Research source To avoid your Timberlands falling off of your feet, lace the bottom eyelets more tightly and leave the laces loose around the ankles. You can also try re-lacing the shoes while skipping every other eyelet. Leave the top eyelet undone.

steps.title: Timbs don’t always have to be casual!
steps.content: Timbs don’t always have to be casual! You can make them look more dressed-up by lacing them tightly around your ankles. This will give you a clean, fitted look. [4] X Research source Try changing up how you lace your Timbs based on what you're wearing.

steps.title: Slip into a plain tee as the base of your outfit.
steps.content: Slip into a plain tee as the base of your outfit. Then, keep things loose with a pair of baggy jeans, along with a sturdy, rugged jacket. Slide into your Timbs to finish off this casual look. [5] X Research source Create a cool contrast with tan Timbs and dark jeans. A bomber or jean jacket works well with this look.

steps.title: Timberlands were originally created to be work boots.
steps.content: Timberlands were originally created to be work boots. To lean into this casual style, try pairing your Timbs with cargo pants or even overalls. Then, finish off the outfit with a white tee. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Try a long puffy coat with skinny jeans to play with different proportions.
steps.content: Try a long puffy coat with skinny jeans to play with different proportions. Add a touch of luxe by looking for a coat with fur around the hood. [7] X Research source Try a pea-coat for a more preppy look.

steps.title: Start off your look with a varsity-style jacket.
steps.content: Start off your look with a varsity-style jacket. Then, balance out the jacket with your favorite pair of blue jeans. Slip on your Timbs, and you’re to head outside! [8] X Research source

steps.title: Sweaters add a cozy, elegant touch that contrasts with your Timbs.
steps.content: Sweaters add a cozy, elegant touch that contrasts with your Timbs. Slip on your favorite sweater, along with a pair of slim-fitting jeans. If it’s especially cold out, bundle up in a cozy hat and scarf before braving the elements. [9] X Research source You can tuck your jeans into your boots for a more polished outfit, or leave them untucked.

steps.title: Slip into a slim-cut bomber jacket to keep your outfit on the streetwear side.
steps.content: Slip into a slim-cut bomber jacket to keep your outfit on the streetwear side. To make your look even edgier, wear a black leather jacket instead. [10] X Research source Burgundy, khaki, and olive green bomber jackets all pair well with Timbs.

steps.title: Pick out a matching top and pair of pants.
steps.content: Pick out a matching top and pair of pants. To really go the extra mile, slip on a matching coat or cardigan to create a streamlined outfit. Finish off your eye-catching ensemble with a matching pair of Timbs. [11] X Research source You might pair a white top with a white pair of jeans, along with a white cardigan and a white pair of Timbs.

steps.title: Wear a dark wash, slim-cut pair of jeans with a fitted chambray shirt.
steps.content: Wear a dark wash, slim-cut pair of jeans with a fitted chambray shirt. To make the look extra rugged, pick out a distressed pair of jeans. [12] X Research source Triple the denim by adding a jean jacket on top.

steps.title: Contrast the rugged look of these work boots with a flirty dress.
steps.content: Contrast the rugged look of these work boots with a flirty dress. Go for a looser-fitting dress for a casual look, or a short dress for a sexier outfit. To make this outfit cozier, go for a flannel or sweater dress and tights.

steps.title: Slip into a pair of slim, form-fitting jeans.
steps.content: Slip into a pair of slim, form-fitting jeans. Then, show off a little skin by wearing a crop top over top. To complete your look, slide on a cardigan, and put on your favorite pair of Timbs. [13] X Research source This type of outfit works great with neutral tones. For instance, you might mix a white crop top and jeans with a dark cardigan, along with a tan pair of Timberlands.

steps.title: A pair of sturdy Timbs are an excellent companion on summer days.
steps.content: A pair of sturdy Timbs are an excellent companion on summer days. Pick out a pair of comfortable shorts, along with a button-down shirt or another breezy top. Finish things off with a pair of ankle socks, along with a pair of Timbs. [14] X Research source Just about any top works well with a summer outfit—staying cool is what’s most important.

steps.title: Slip into a pair of slim, comfortable camo pants.
steps.content: Slip into a pair of slim, comfortable camo pants. Contrast the pattern with a plain white tee, along with a denim jacket. Finish off your streetwise outfit with your favorite pair of Timbs. [15] X Research source Slim pants help add a modern twist to this nostalgic look.

steps.title: The yellow, high-top Timbs are classics for a reason.
steps.content: The yellow, high-top Timbs are classics for a reason. Throw them on with any outfit and you'll instantly add an element of cool. [16] X Research source Yellow Timberlands are instantly recognizable and can be dressed up or down. When in doubt, go with the originals.

steps.title: These Timbs are great for a monochromatic look.
steps.content: These Timbs are great for a monochromatic look. Black Timbs can add either a touch of sophistication or grunge to your look, depending on what you pair them with. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Timbs also come in colors like red, blue, and pink.
steps.content: Timbs also come in colors like red, blue, and pink. Try finishing an all-black outfit off with bright Timberlands, or go for a fun, colorful look from head to toe. [18] X Research source Timberlands also make boots in limited-edition colors and patterns, so keep an eye out if you want to add an unusual style to your closet.
